text: hello friends welcome back I am Niharika
and in today's lesson we are going to
talk about
interjections well that's a big word and
what does it mean well have you heard of
words like you or aw or eat well these
are called interjections do you think
these words have any meaning to it well
let me tell you an interjection is a
word that is used innocent tense to
convey an emotion or sentiment which
kind of shows expressions like surprise
disgust excitement enthusiasm and so on
so many people these days use these
interjections while chatting or while
speaking so let's have a look at these
words and let's learn when to use the
right one so the first one that we have
over here is arc like argh
you know something that expresses
frustration or anger so when you have to
express anger or frustration or
annoyance or something you can use this
expression work okay like curb this car
doesn't work or earn the battery is dead
you know so you are showing annoyance or
anger okay the next one that we have is
all now this interjection has two kind
of emotions to it the first one is when
you have to express affection you know
when you find something really sweet or
adorable then you say all for example
all the baby is so cute or all the puppy
is so adorable so that is when you use
the interjection all and the second
emotion that it can raise is
disappointment when you have to express
disappointment you say oh that's sad
like for example if your friend comes
and tell
my grandmom fell off the stairs last
night
you won't say oh so cute that's wrong
well you would say all that's sad okay
so here are your expressing
disappointment so the first would be
expressing affection and the second one
would be disappointment all right let's
have a look at another interjection
which is duh now da is expressing
annoyance or something very obvious or
very dumb okay for example if someone
tells you that it is really hot in the
desert region well of course it is hot
it's pretty obvious it's not going to be
freezing in a desert so you would say
duh of course it is hot you know so it's
something which is very obvious okay
something that is just too dumb or for
example you are trying to charge your
phone and it's not getting charged and
then you realize that you know you did
not plug the charger in so you would say
duh I didn't plug the charger in okay so
that was just too dumb of me right then
the next one that we have is take now
ich is a very girly scream okay which
expresses fear or surprise
all right so either it expresses fear or

okay so that's a very girly scream and
that's what people use when they try to
express fear okay the next one that we
have is you now you is expressing
disgust Takei's something that you find
is really disgusting okay you would say
you like that Apple is rotten you right
so you are expressing disgust now let's
have a look at the next one here which
is G or G's now this also expresses
surprise okay something that you are
very surprised with someone told you
that I scored full marks in this test
they are like geez
really okay so that's an expression of
surprise all right then the other one
that we have for you is whoops or
whoops-a-daisy now this interjection
acknowledges your minor mistakes maybe
you spilt the coffee so you would say
oops I spilled the coffee or nowadays
people also use whoops-a-daisy okay
that's pretty interesting so
whoops-a-daisy I forgot my phone at home
so you are acknowledging your mistake
okay
so you can either use oops
whoops-a-daisy or you can also say
whoops okay just the simple whoops that
is when you are acknowledging your
mistake the next one that we have is ro

two emotions to it the first one is when

whoa
you are going really fast you need to
calm down okay that is when you use whoa
but you also use this interjection to
express surprise okay it's like whoa
that's like amazing or that's like
incredible so is this what you drew on
this test paper whoa that's like amazing
okay so here again you are expressing

all right the next one that we have is
Wow
well very commonly used by everybody
when you find something really
fascinating when you are really amazed
to see something you say Wow okay so
that's a very common interjection that
is used to express amazement or to
express a a great surprise okay for
example if you see a very amazing car
you would say wow what an amazing car so
here you are amazed to see the car okay
and that's why you are using this
interjection so when you find something
really amazing okay something which is
incredible you would use the
interjection Wow and the last one that

expresses joy excitement celebrating
something good you know okay so when you
are really excited about something maybe
you just heard something good then you
would say yeah that's a great news okay
my sister is pregnant maybe that's a

joy right so these are a couple of
